revised_title: Comparative Study of Solar and Terrestrial Rays and Their Effects on Heat and Light
tldr: This paper investigates the properties of solar and terrestrial rays that cause heat and light. The author, William Herschel, conducts experiments on the different types of heat and their corresponding rays, comparing them to the known properties of light. The results show that both solar and terrestrial heat rays are subject to the laws of reflection and refraction, supporting the idea that heat and light are related phenomena.
